DOC.brief_summary: The FARGO trial prospective , randomize ( 1:1 ) , multicenter study . The aim study assess importance fractional flow reserve ( FFR ) assessment prior coronary artery bypass grafting ( CABG ) respect plan guide revascularization strategy . The study compare FFR-guided strategy angiography-guided strategy patient plan surgical revascularization .
DOC.brief_title: Fractional Flow Reserve Versus Angiography Randomization Graft Optimization Trial
DOC.detailed_description: FFR measurement make patient enters study . FFR measurement coronary artery intermediate stenosis , plan grafting , do CABG perform . Patients randomize either FFR-guided CABG Angiography guide CABG .
DOC.criteria: Stable angina unstable angina / NSTEMI ( Non ST segment elevation myocardial infarction ) candidate CABG At least one study lesion , intermediate lesion plan graft Heart Team Meeting . ( Definition Study lesion : ≥ 50 % stenosis major epicardiel artery ( proximal reference segment diameter > 2.5 mm ) , pass FFRwire without significant risk . Study Lesions draw coronary artery . ) Signed informed consent form Significant valvular disease indication surgical treatment Previous openheartsurgery Left main lesion without intermediate lesion Treatment Persantin Retard One vessel disease Renal impairment ( creatinine ≥ 150 umol / l )
